    • Field Detail

      • TIME_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String TIME_FORMAT

        The SDL standard time format HH:mm:ss.SSS-z

        Note: SDL uses a 24 hour clock (0-23)

        Note: This is not the same as a time span. This format is used for the time component of a date_time instance

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATE_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String DATE_FORMAT

        The SDL standard date format yyyy/MM/dd

        Note: SDL uses the Gregorian calendar

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATE_TIME_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String DATE_TIME_FORMAT
        The SDL standard DATE_TIME format yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss.SSS-z

        Note: SDL uses a 24 hour clock (0-23) and the Gregorian calendar

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.Object object)
        Create an SDL string representation for an object (note: Strings and Characters will be surrounded by quotes)
        Parameters:
        object - The object to format
        Returns:
        an SDL string representation for an object

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.Object object,
                                      boolean addQuotes)
        Create an SDL string representation for an object
        Parameters:
        object - The object to format
        addQuotes - Quotes will be added to Strings and Characters if true
        Returns:
        an SDL string representation for an object

      • coerceOrFail

        public static java.lang.Object coerceOrFail(java.lang.Object obj)

        Coerce the type to a standard SDL type or throw an illegal argument exception if no coercion is possible.

        Coercion table

        String, Character, Integer, Long, Float, Double, BigDecimal, Boolean, Calendar, SDLTimeSpan -> No change Byte[] -> byte[] Byte, Short -> Integer Date -> Calendar
        Parameters:
        obj - An object to coerce
        Returns:
        Coerced object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type is coercible to a legal SDL type

      • validateIdentifier

        public static void validateIdentifier(java.lang.String identifier)
        Validates an SDL identifier String. SDL Identifiers must start with a Unicode letter or underscore (_) and contain only unicode letters, digits, underscores (_), and dashes(-).
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier to validate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the identifier is not legal

      • value

        public static java.lang.Object value(java.lang.String literal)
        Get the value represented by a string containing an SDL literal.
        Parameters:
        literal - The literal string to parse
        Returns:
        A value for an SDL literal
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the text is null or the text does not represent a valid SDL literal
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the text represents a malformed number.

      • list

        public static java.util.List list(java.lang.String valueList)

        Parse the string of values and return a list. The string is handled as if it is the values portion of an SDL tag.

        Example

        List list = SDL.list("1 true 12:24:01");

        Will return an int, a boolean, and a time span.

        Note: If you want the more descriptive SDLParseException to be thrown use:

        List list = new Tag("root").read("1 true 12:24:01") .getChild("content").getValues();
        Parameters:
        valueList - A string of space separated SDL literals
        Returns:
        A list of values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the string is null or contains literals that cannot be parsed

      • map

        public static java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map(java.lang.String attributeString)

        Parse a string representing the attributes portion of an SDL tag and return the results as a map.

        Example

        Map<String,Object> m = SDL.map("value=1 debugging=on time=12:24:01");

        Will return a map containing value=1, debugging=true, and time=12:24:01

        Note: If you want the more descriptive SDLParseException to be thrown use:

        Map<String,Object> m = new Tag("root") .read("atts " + attributeString).getChild("atts") .getAttributes();
        Parameters:
        attributeString - A string of space separated key=value pairs
        Returns:
        A map created from the attribute string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the string is null or contains literals that cannot be parsed or the map is malformed
